summary: This is a formal request for international legal assistance from the Paris Prosecutor's Office to U.S. authorities, dated July 8, 2020. It concerns the French investigation into Jean-Luc Brunel and others in connection with the Epstein case, specifically regarding allegations of sexual abuse of minors and participation in a criminal association. The document outlines the legal basis, facts of the investigation, and specific requests for evidence from U.S. investigations.

persons.name: Jean-Luc Brunel
persons.context: French modeling agency director accused of sexual assault and rape of young women and models, and of supplying girls from his agency to Jeffrey Epstein. He is a central target of the French investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the international sex trafficking investigation. The French investigation is linked to his case, focusing on potential French victims and his associates like Brunel and Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Accused of organizing the travel and stay of future victims at Epstein's residences. Mentioned as being arrested in the U.S. on July 2, 2020. The French request seeks information on her.

persons.name: Aude Groualle
persons.role: Vice-Prosecutor, Head of the Paris juvenile prosecutor's office
persons.context: Magistrate who issued this mutual legal assistance request.

persons.name: Barthélémy Hennuyer
persons.role: Deputy prosecutor, juvenile section of the Paris Prosecutor's Office
persons.context: Substitute prosecutor who signed the request on behalf of the Paris Prosecutor.

persons.name: Prince Albert de Monaco
persons.context: Mentioned by a witness as having called Jean-Luc Brunel while she was in his apartment. His role is not specified beyond this mention.

connections.description: Described as close friends. The document states Brunel supplied young girls from his modeling agency to Epstein.
Described as a couple in one witness account. Maxwell allegedly organized the travel and stays of victims at Epstein's various residences.
Both are named as targets of the French investigation and the U.S. mutual legal assistance request in connection with Epstein's network.

events.title: Opening of French Preliminary Investigation
events.description: The Paris juvenile prosecutor's office opens a preliminary investigation for rape, sexual assault, and participation in a criminal association, targeting Jeffrey Epstein and his possible accomplices concerning French victims.

events.title: Initial Report from 'Innocence en danger'
events.description: The Paris Prosecutor receives a report from the child defense association 'Innocence en danger' indicating France is involved in the Epstein case and that there are French victims.

events.title: Search of Epstein's Paris Home
events.description: A search is conducted at Jeffrey Epstein's Paris residence at 22 Avenue Foch. Computers, storage devices, documents related to Ghislaine Maxwell, and numerous photographs of young women are seized.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is arrested on American soil, as noted in the French request.

events.title: Issuance of Mutual Legal Assistance Request
events.description: The Paris Prosecutor's Office formally issues this request to U.S. authorities for evidence and information related to Brunel, Maxwell, and French victims.

locations: Avenue Hoche, Paris (Jean-Luc Brunel's Paris home)
keyFacts: The French investigation, opened in August 2019, focuses on sexual crimes against minors and participation in a criminal association linked to Jeffrey Epstein's network, specifically targeting Jean-Luc Brunel.
The document alleges Jean-Luc Brunel, a modeling agency director, was a close friend of Epstein and supplied him with young girls from his agency's pool of models.
A search of Epstein's Paris home in September 2019 yielded computers, documents on Ghislaine Maxwell, and many photographs of young or very young women.
The formal request asks U.S. authorities for all investigative acts related to Brunel, Maxwell, and any French victims who had contact with Epstein, Brunel, or Maxwell.
The document references multiple witness accounts alleging sexual assaults by Jean-Luc Brunel in Paris, though some are noted as being legally time-barred (prescribed).
